metadata.feature_description: Handle timezone conversions for page scheduling and dates

steps.action: Navigate to Pages section and select Home page
steps.expected: Page details should load with scheduling section visible
steps.actual: Page details loaded successfully with Enable Scheduling section visible showing Start Date and End Date

steps.action: View scheduling dates in page details
steps.expected: Dates should be displayed with proper timezone handling
steps.actual: Start Date (01/20/2026 10:30 PM) and End Date (03/02/2026 05:00 PM) displayed correctly with LT (Local Time) indicator

steps.action: Modify the Start Date by changing day from 20 to 21
steps.expected: Date picker should allow modification and show unsaved changes
steps.actual: Date picker opened, day changed to 21, 'Changes have not been saved' message appeared, Save button became enabled

steps.action: Click Save button to save the modified date
steps.expected: Save operation should complete successfully with timezone handling applied
steps.actual: Save completed successfully with 'Page updated successfully' message displayed. Timezone handling code (FixTimeZone method) processed the date correctly by ensuring UTC kind for storage

observations: Code review confirms FixTimeZone method in EvoqPagesController.cs (lines 380-398) handles timezone conversion by specifying DateTimeKind.Utc for dates with unspecified kind
FixTimeZone is called both on GetPageDetails (retrieve) and SavePageDetails (save) to ensure consistent UTC storage
UI displays 'LT' (Local Time) indicator next to date pickers, suggesting frontend handles conversion for display purposes
Daylight Saving Time handling is implicitly supported through UTC storage - dates are stored as UTC and converted to local time on display
UTC storage verification: Code explicitly sets DateTimeKind.Utc for StartDate and EndDate when their Kind is Unspecified
